position.marginalia_text: Archidoxis Theophrastiae pars prima Noven libri de misterijs Natura[e] Theophr. Bombast de Hohenb. Suevij Heremita[e], Naturaliu[m] rerum docti Paracelsi Mag[ist]ri Phi[lippus] industriasissimi lib[er] 1. de Misterijs Microcosmi [liber] 2. [de Misterijs] elementor[um] [liber] 3. [de Misterijs] s[anct]a essentia [liber] 4. [de Misterijs] Arcani [liber] 5. [de Misterijs] ...tractionum [liber] 6. [de Misterijs] s... [liber] 7. [de Misterijs] ... [liber] 8. De misterijs extremis liber 9 De praxi, sed no[n] est impressus

marginalia.translation: The first part of Theophrastus' Archidoxa Nine books on the mysteries of nature by Theophrastus Bombast of Hohenberg, Paracelsus learned in natural matters Book 1 On the mysteries of the microcosmos Book 2 On the mysteries of the elements Book 3 On the mysteries of the holy essence Book 4 On the mysteries of the arcane Book 5 On the mysteries of the ... Book 6 On the mysteries of the Book 7 On the mysteries of the Book 8 On the extreme mysteries Book 9 On the practice, but it is not printed yet.

position.marginalia_text: This above written and the name on the top of the frontisspice of this booke [and] [the] writing in the middle of the fro[n]tisspice and the severall notes in the margent through the whole booke, was written by that famous Philosopher and Chimist John Dee. w[i]th his owne hand. this J[ohn] Dee: was he [that] wrote the philosophicall treatise called Monae Hieroglifica. also Propaideumata Aphoriastic also the learned preface before Euclides Elements in English in folio. he was warden of Manchester. I have dito ere books [that] were his wher he hath written his name and many notes [etc]: for w[i]ch they are worthyly the more esteemed. John Winthrop. Juli 24 1640..
